The Voting Information Project (VIP) works to connect voters with the essential information needed to cast their ballot, such as where to vote and what is on the ballot. It is a project between The Pew Charitable Trusts, Google, and the states. Launched in 2008, VIP works with state and local election officials to provide official election information to citizens through a variety of means, including the Google Civic Information API. This app one of the many made available through VIP, ensuring official election information is accessible to voters before and on Election Day.

Effective Date: 6/11/14

The Voting Information Project ("VIP"), a project of The Pew Charitable Trusts ("Pew"), provides users with official election and polling place information, collected from and verified by state and local election officials.

VIP is nonpartisan online voter resource, partnering with organizations and election officials committed to leveraging technology to provide official voting information to voters where they look for it most. By using the VIP Application (the "App") and the services offered through the App, including, but not limited to the VIP state feeds (collectively with the App, the "Use"), you agree to be bound by these Terms of Use and the terms of the Voting Information Project Privacy Policy, as in effect at the time you access the App.

Use Guidelines and Prohibitions
You agree to Use the services solely for personal, not-for-profit or educational purposes. You agree not to Use the services to: (a) violate any law, or (b) disobey any requirements, procedures, policies or regulations of networks connected to the services, or interfere with or disrupt the services, the App or servers or networks connected to the App.

By accessing the App or any other service provided through the App, you agree to abide by the following standards of conduct. You agree that you will not, nor will you authorize or facilitate any attempt by another person, to use the App or any service provided through the App to:

1)Attempt to decipher, decompile, disassemble, or reverse-engineer any of the software comprising or in any way making up a part of the App;
2)Transmit any Content that includes files or hyperlinks which contain viruses, worms, Trojan horses, spyware, malware, or any other destructive features, or any data otherwise intended to interfere with the proper working of the App; or
3)Violate any federal, state, local, or international law or regulation.

Accessing (or attempting to access) any of our resources by any means other than through the means we provide, is strictly prohibited. You specifically agree not to access (or attempt to access) any of our resources through any automated, unethical or unconventional means.

Ownership and License
All right, title, and interest in and to VIP and VIP content are and will remain the exclusive property of Pew and its licensors.

Pew hereby grants to you a nonexclusive, term, limited, irrevocable, royalty-free, worldwide license (the "License") to install, execute, load, operate, display, customize, and otherwise use the App solely for personal, not-for-profit or educational purposes, subject to the restrictions set forth in these Terms of Use.

Indemnification
By using this the App, you agree to indemnify, hold harmless, and defend Pew and its employees and agents from any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, and all costs and expenses of defense, including but not limited to, attorneysí fees, resulting directly or indirectly from a claim by you or a third-party that arises in connection with: (i) your violation of any term of these Terms of Use; (ii) your violation of any third-party right, including without limitation any copyright, property, or privacy right; or (iii) any claim that any sharing of information caused damage to a third-party. This defense and indemnification obligation will survive these Terms of Use and your use of the App.

Limitation of Liability
All use of VIP and VIP content is provided "as is" and at your own risk.

Pew will not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential or exemplary loss or damages which may be incurred by you as a result of using our resources, or as a result of any charges, data loss or corruption, cancellation, loss of access, or downtime to the full extent that applicable limitation of liability laws apply.

Privacy
VIP does not collect any personally identifiable information and does not collect or distribute any information entered by a user, including address information. You understand that any information provided by you or collected by Pew in connection with your Use will be used in the manner described in these Terms of Service and in the VIP Privacy Policy, such privacy policy being incorporated into and made a part of these Terms of Service by this reference.

Jurisdiction and Choice of Law
These Terms of Service, and any disputes arising from or relating to the conduct covered by the Terms of Service, are governed by the laws of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania. You hereby submit to the exclusive jurisdiction, including waiving any objection to personal jurisdiction, of the courts of the Philadelphia, Pennsylvania without regards to any principles of conflicts of laws and the United Nations Convention on Contracts for the International Sale of Goods. Those who choose to access the Services from locations outside of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania do so on their own initiative contrary to the terms of these Terms of Service, and are responsible for compliance with local laws if and to the extent local laws are applicable.

Questions

Effective Date: 6/11/14

The Voting Information Project ("VIP"), a project of The Pew Charitable Trusts ("Pew"), values your privacy and does not require that users enter personally identifiable information or information about an individual that could reasonably be used to identify that individual. This Privacy Policy ("Privacy Policy") describes the types of information that VIP gathers from you when you use our App and associated services (the "Service"). Our Service does not require you to provide your first and last name, residential address, telephone number, and email address. When accessing the Service, you are only required to provide an address to obtain election information for that address.

By accessing the Service, you agree to be bound by this Privacy Policy. If you do not agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy, please do not use our Service. Each time you use our Service, the current version of the Privacy Policy will apply. Accordingly, whenever you use our Service, you should check the date of this Privacy Policy (which appears at the top) and review any changes since the last version. This Privacy Policy is applicable to all users of the Service.

Further, you acknowledge that this Privacy Policy is part of our Terms of Service and by accessing or using our Service, you agree to be bound by the Terms of Service. If you do not agree to our Terms of Service, do not access or use our Service.

In addition to collecting an address from you for election information purposes, VIP may also collect certain information automatically for analytic purposes, including, but not limited to, using cookies (small piece of data stored in the user's device) and anonymous identifiers when you interact with the Services. Any use of cookies – or of other tracking tools – by the Service or by the owners of third party services used by this App, unless stated otherwise, is for analytic purposes or serves to anonymously identify users and remember their preferences for the purpose of providing the Service requested. Pew shares the limited information that it collects with third party service providers, such as Google, to assist with rendering the Service. Use of your information by these third parties is governed by their privacy policy.

VIP employs industry standard security measures to protect the loss, misuse, and alteration of the information used by VIP. VIP has added "Hypertext Transfer Protocol Secure" (HTTPS), a widely used communications protocol for secure communication over a computer network, with especially wide deployment on the Internet. It adds the security capabilities of SSL/TLS to standard HTTP communications.

VIP contains links to third party sites, partnering organizations, applications and services not operated by us. These links are provided as a service and do not imply any endorsement by Pew of the activities or content of these sites, applications or services nor any association with their operators. Pew is not responsible for the privacy policies or practices of any third party including websites or services directly linked to our Service. We encourage you to review the privacy policies of any third party site that you link from our Service.

Pew reserves the right to update or modify this Privacy Policy from time to time. If Pew makes any material changes to this Privacy Policy or the way that Pew uses, shares or collects personally identifiable information, Pew will notify you by revising the "Effective Date" at the top of this Privacy Policy or prominently posting an announcement of the changes through the Service prior to the new policy taking effect. Users are bound by any changes to the Privacy Policy after notice of such changes have been communicated. Pew encourages you to review this Privacy Policy regularly to ensure that you are familiar with current practices.

If you have any questions or concerns about this Privacy Policy or our privacy practices please contact us as follows:

By emailing the Privacy Department at info@votinginfoproject.org

 By mail post to:

 Privacy Department
Voting Information Project
Election Initiatives
901 E St. NW
Washington, DC 20004–2008

Your upcoming election is mail-only. Please contact your local election official to learn more about how to receive and return your ballot.
